description:
Variable level metadata individual fields integrated into the variable level
metadata object within the HEAL platform metadata service.

> Only `name`` and `description` are required. The other fields are either recommended (but optional) or optional.
title: HEAL Variable Level Metadata Fields

fields.name: module
fields.description:
The section, form, survey instrument, set of measures  or other broad category used 
to group variables.
fields.title: Module

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of a variable (i.e., field) as it appears in the data.
fields.title: Variable Name

fields.name: title
fields.description: The human-readable title or label of the variable.
fields.title: Variable Label (ie Title)

fields.name: description
fields.description: An extended description of the variable. This could be the definition of a variable or the question text (e.g., if a survey).
fields.title: Variable Description

fields.name: type
fields.description:
The data type of the variable. This categorization allows the researcher to know what operations can be performed
with the variable (i.e., statistical test) in addition to telling the computer how to effectively store these data.
fields.title: Variable Type

examples.number: A numeric value with optional decimal places. (e.g., 3.14)

examples.integer: A whole number without decimal places. (e.g., 42)

examples.any: Any type of data is allowed. (e.g., true)

examples.boolean: A binary value representing true or false. (e.g., true)

examples.datetime: A specific date and time, including timezone information. (e.g., "2023-05-25T10:30:00Z")

examples.geopoint: A pair of latitude and longitude coordinates. (e.g., [51.5074, -0.1278])

fields.name: format
fields.description: A format taken from one of the [frictionless specification](https://specs.frictionlessdata.io/) schemas. For example, for tabular data, there is the [Table Schema specification](https://specs.frictionlessdata.io/table-schema)
fields.title: Frictionless Formats

fields.name: constraints.maxLength
fields.description:
Indicates the maximum length of an iterable (e.g., array, string, or
object). For example, if 'Hello World' is the longest value of a
categorical variable, this would be a maxLength of 11.
fields.title: Maximum Length

fields.name: constraints.enum
fields.description: Constrains possible values to a set of values.
fields.title: Variable Possible Values

fields.name: constraints.pattern
fields.description: A regular expression pattern the data MUST conform to.
fields.title: Regular Expression Pattern

fields.name: constraints.maximum
fields.description:
Specifies the maximum value of a field (e.g., maximum -- or most
recent -- date, maximum integer etc). Note, this is different then
maxLength property.
fields.title: Maximum Value

fields.name: encodings
fields.description:
Encodings (and mappings) allow categorical values to be stored as
numerical values. IMPORTANT: the ==key should be the value represented IN
the data== and the ==value should be the to-be-mapped label==. Many
analytic software programs use numerical encodings and some algorithms
only support numerical values. Additionally, this field provides a way to
store categoricals that are stored as  "short" labels (such as
abbreviations).
fields.title: Variable Value Encodings (i.e., mappings; value labels)

fields.name: ordered
fields.description:
Indicates whether a categorical variable is ordered. This variable  is
relevant for variables that have an ordered relationship but not
necessarily  a numerical relationship (e.g., Strongly disagree < Disagree
< Neutral < Agree).
fields.title: An ordered variable

fields.name: missingValues
fields.description: A list of missing values specific to a variable.
fields.title: Missing Values

fields.name: falseValues
fields.description:
For boolean (false) variable (as defined in type field), this field allows
a physical string representation to be cast as false (increasing
readability of the field) that is not a standard false value. It can include one or more values.
fields.title: Boolean False Value Labels

fields.name: repo_link
fields.description: A link to the variable as it exists on the home repository, if applicable
fields.title: Variable Repository Link

fields.name: standardsMappings
fields.description:
A mapping(s) to a published set of standard variables such as the NIH Common Data Elements program.
One or more mappings can be specified.
fields.title: Standards Mappings

fields.name: relatedConcepts
fields.description:
A set of published concepts related to the given field such as 
ontological information (eg., NCI thesaurus, bioportal etc)
fields.title: Related concepts
